For teeth
Sal ammoniac i ℥, rock salt 1 ℥, alum half ℥. Make water with the cornue, and no matter how little of it you touch the tooth with, the tartar and blackness will go away. It is that it has a bad odor, but you can mix it with rose honey and a little clove oil or cinammon oil.
p047r_2
Antimony oil
It yellows quite strongly, even silver, if you put it on it once heated.
p047r_3
Against epilepsy or dizziness
Wear, hung to your collar, some root of paeonia which has been plucked when the moon is waning.
p047r_4
Crucibles
Those from Bayonne, which seem to be made of grès, are better because they last, without comparison, longer than others. And since they are not very thick, one wastes less charcoal to melt gold and silver because they are quickly heated. They do not absorb silver as much as others, and for this reason, there is not much laveure to be found in them. They are also not as likely to fall over as others that have a flat foot.
p047r_5
Against diarrhea and dysentery
Against diarrhea, it is good to use preserve of symphytum, also [known as] consolida maior. And in to addition to this, if it is against dysentery, you can rub the temples, the hollow of the hands, and the sole of the feet with oil of wax and take a drop of two of it with a spoonful of broth. Root of consolida maior, crushed and put between cuts in a piece of beef, then boiled, is said to rejoin them.
